The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#17558](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/17558.html) (build: organize tests by goal by RandyMcMil

### Gitian builds | File | commit ae6943620ab369e8e0865c3ec2d2848ba9389325
(master) | commit 0378a9d9c4ea8d1ad57782bcfec78d52ab1f4f5e
(master and this pull) | |--|--|--| | bitcoin-0.19.99-osx-unsigned.dmg | [`a7077050e4e2bed9...`](https://drahtbot.space/gitian/bitcoin/bitcoin/ae6943620ab369e8e0865c3ec2d2848ba9389325/bitcoin-0.19.99-osx-unsigned.d

So this bumps the supported OSX version, but doesn't bump the SDK? (At least not a major version of the SDK?)\n\nEdit: What I'm trying to ask is, could we have bumped the supported OSX version without bumping the SDK?

> could we have bumped the supported OSX version without bumping the SDK\n\nThat's what this PR is doing. This increases our minimum supported macOS version from `10.10` to `10.12`. Nothing SDK related is changing, the change to start using the `10.14` SDK over the `10.11` SDK is still in #16392.
